page.title: 11Farm near Brackley
page.content: The wife of a local farmer came to tell us about her farm. It is one of the smallest farms in the area; they own 46 acres and rent a further 49 acres. It is a dairy farm and they own 70 cows (and 7 horses wich they ride for pleasure). The milk is sold to the milk marketing board. On their land they grow grass and they turn some of it into silage and some into hay. It is hard work, especially in winter and if it is snowing they somtimes connot get across their fields. Somtimes vandals come on to the farm and destroy farm land and mess about with the hay. Despite this all the family enjoy living on a farm. This farm does not use any sprays or chemicals, but of course some sprays are blown over from other farms onto other peoples land.
